intro: Palicourea croatii, commonly known as Brazilian jasmine or yellow madrone, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small, clustered, and range in color from white to yellow, contributing to its ornamental value.
